fields.description:
The Bugzilla Importer keeps track of which issues were imported by recording Bugzilla key -> JIRA id mappings in the changeitem table. If the user attempts to import a Bugzilla project twice, the second import will print lots of "Issue: FOO-123 already exists. Not Imported" messages and refuse to import the issues twice.

I suppose this prevention of duplicate imports could be considered a feature, but in practice it is just annoying. For instance, say I import a project, then realise the key is wrong.  I should be able to delete the imported project, and reimport the issues, but I can't without hacking the database to remove the Bugzilla -> JIRA records in changeitem
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer: cannot import, delete and reimport

fields.description:
In the popup issue selector for link issue, we currently show the most recent 50 issues from the current search, and also the most recent issues.

Allow this to be changed so that you can also choose from a saved search.
fields.summary: Allow the selection of saved filters in the popup issue linking

fields.description:
We have our jira installation at the following URL within the JPMorganChase intranet:

http://jira.uk.jpmorgan.com/fort/irfe

... with the base URL for the installation set accordingly.

When I attempt to do a bulk delete of issues, and get as far as the final screen indicating a confirmation, clicking the button attempts to route to...

http://jira.uk.jpmorgan.com/secure/BulkDeletePerform.jspa

... rather than...

http://jira.uk.jpmorgan.com/fort/irfe/secure/BulkDeletePerform.jspa

... and I get a "Page not found" error in the browser.

I notice from viewing the page source that all other links on the page contain relative URLs of the form, for example,

src="/fort/irfe/images/icons/bullet_done.gif"

.. whereas the button for the confirmation has the action

action="/secure/BulkDeletePerform.jspa"

... missing off the /fort/irfe

As a workaround, I found that entering

http://jira.uk.jpmorgan.com/fort/irfe/secure/BulkDeletePerform.jspa

... directly into the browser address bar at this stage had the desired affect.
fields.summary: Error in page routing when confirming bulk delete

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3427].
  {panel}

Hi

We are trying to use the time tracking features in JIRA as much as possible.

One of the main places for room for improvement is reporting. Currently, the only reports are the time tracking report and the developer workload report.

Those two reports have a very specific filter which cannot be configured.

Wouldn't it be a good idea, easy enough, to use the current filtering system in JIRA, and extend it with a "time tracking view" option, so only the selected items in the filter are used in the time tracking report?

So if I want to do a time tracking report of issues for version 3.0 in the "UI" component, i can first do a search for those isssues, and then click on a "time tracking view" button/link.

Of course, this ideally should be complemented by the ability to use the time tracking fields on a search (see JRA-961).
fields.summary: Filter-based time tracking reports
Log is viewable by all even if restricted to a group

fields.description:
One of my user entered a <Comments> into an issue and lost everything when trying to commit that to the database.  

He lost about 30 min. of his time entering that comment!!

There is no indication in the Web interface how long can be a <Comment> ?

At least, if the <Comment> is too long, JIRA should instruct the user that his comments are too long. Instead, JIRA returns a page stating that the issue no longer exists and there's no way to retrieve the contents of the <Comments> field !!

fields.description:
We are planing to invite our customers to post feature requests and defects about our software.
Right now, i can add only one field layout scheme to a project and all users will see all fields of this scheme. It makes no sense, e.g. that the customer can set a fix version, he should not be able to do so, as he does not know. 
I would suggest a general solution, to avoid the discussion for every field.

1. Solution: A issue field security level (smiliar to issue security level)- For each field a security level is applicable. Only those fields are visible for the user group, that are a member of this issue field security level. Users/ user groups not a member of this security level will not see this field (the field is hid)

2. minor Solution: More detailed permissions for the system fields: e.g. "Set fixed version", "set component": not having the permission will not allow me to edit the fields (as is already implemented for assigning users) 

3. Solution: create a master layout scheme for the project.
create a sub layout scheme on user group level. each user will see only the fields of their user group, even though all fields exit in the database. Some user groups may then see more fields than others.

In order not to generate errors with required fields, it should 
be possible to set default values for all system fields (not just custom fields): e.g. default value for component=unknown, fix version=unkown. 

maybe this issue could be solved by the requirement of adding a general customer object.
fields.summary: Hiding issue fields for some users /user groups

fields.description:
If a field protected by another permission than EDIT is marked Required after an issue has been created with that field blank, when a user that does not have that other permission goes to edit an issue he will not be able to. The reason is that the field is not shown to him as he does not have the other permission, but the validation fails as the field is marked required - since the field is not on the page the error is never rendered on the page.

Can think of 2 cases for this issue:
- Fix Versions due to RESOLVE Permission
- Due Date due to the SCHEDULE permission

This also happens during issue creation if Fix Versions is required and the user does not have RESOLVE permission.

Also see linked issue for the security level field.
fields.summary: Cannot create and/or edit issue due to 'required' fields and permission mismatches

When viewing issue's Version Control tab and then switching to an issue that is part of a project that has no CVS repositories associated, the "Version Control" tab is rendered anyway. The "header" of the Version Control tab is not shown at all as the project has no repositories, but the contents is rendered as "no commits for this issue". Due to the "missing" header it is difficult for the user to see what tab they are actually seeing.

Need to switch to the default (comments) tab when going from Version Control tab of an issue to an issue which does not have that tab.
fields.summary: Version Control Tab displayed even when no associated CVS repository exists

fields.description:
According to the lucene docs[1], searching for a quoted string (eg "fix for") ought to search for that phrase.  However JIRA 2.6 searches for the individual words "fix" or "for".


[1] http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v2.6/querysyntax.html
fields.summary: Searching for quoted text returns results for each quoted word

fields.description:
If the user does not have a JRE installed JIRA directs the user to an old version of Suns JRE (version 1.3.1_09):
http://java.sun.com/update/1.3.1/jinstall-1_3_1_09-windows-i586.cab#Version=1,3,1,9

I've only tested this on ONE client, so I'm not totaly sure this is the problem, but after installing the old JRE the client could not attach a screenshot (the applet loaded fine, but when clicking the paste button nothing happend).

I uninstalled the old JRE, went to Suns webpage, downloaded and installed the newest one (1.4.2_04). After this I closed all browser windows and tried again. Now the paste button worked fine.
fields.summary: Paste button in Attach Screenshot  applet does not work with suggested JRE

This keeps coming up and I'm slowly getting a bunch of messages that are "bouncing" in my log files.

TIA

4. Project B is no longer assoicated with Repository A (set to 'None').

fields.description: Add access to search filters in issue picker when linking an issue. Alos, add ability to configure issue picker to use specified search filter by default.
fields.summary: Add search filter selector to issue picker when linking.

fields.description:
Use Case:
Login to JIRA
select the 'reported by me' link.

Now select a single project from the projects drop-down
the page reloads empty.
click 'view'
The page now shows the issues reported by you, for the selected project.

Select another project from the projects drop-down
the page reloads empty.
click 'view'
the page now shows the issues reported by you, for the selected project.
 
Is it possible to get the issue navigator to show me those results without having to click 'view'?  It's obvious that it 'remembers' from one selection to another of the projects drop-down. (I don't need to reselect 'current user' as the reporter, for example).
 
I recognize that it's probably not such an easy matter when there were project-specific search fields in the first set of results, and then you switch to a project where that (custom) field is missing... But can't we just 'drop' that field from the search filter, and display the results?

this is particularly helpful when all you want to do is change the project, and run the *exact* same search. (like 'assigned to me' or 'reported by me').

I'm sure I've had this discussion before, but couldn't find it.  Maybe it was only with myself. ;)
fields.summary: empty results when changing projects...
Still allow Admin to add user even though external management is on
Improve CreateIssueHandler to support more issue fields.

fields.description:
Very often, I'm finding while using the system that I'm entering a bug report "for" someone else, maybe it's an email, maybe a conversation in the hall, whatever.

When I enter the report, I'd like to be able to tell JIRA that "joe blow" wants to watch this issue, not me (maybe I do too, but that's another story).

I realize that that could be an issue in some houses, so it'd probably be the kind of feature that only certain users would have access to.

Just a thought.
Darin
fields.summary: Would be nice to be able to tell the system that another user wants to "watch" a bug

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3374].
  {panel}

Hi

This is an idea for a new feature, not a critical thing but it would be very handy.

It'd be great to be able to associate a list of checkable items to an issue. It is quite common to find a case where a particular issue involves more than one steps. These steps are too small and not independent, so they cannot be issues.

If, given an issue, I could maintain a list of TODO items (that I can add, delete, check and uncheck) then it would be easy to keep track on progress, changes on scope, etc...

I found that most engineers, even those that use JIRA intensively, also keep a TODO list on a text file, Outlook Tasks or a piece of paper. It'd be great to integrate these two kinds of granularity in JIRA.

I'd really love to see this one implemented.

Cheers,
Paco

fields.summary: Exception cleaning up and/or destroying managed connection

fields.description: When I enable GZIP compression, the dashboard only shows the administration tasks portlet.  When I turn it off, the dashboard works properly again.  I verified this with two (administrative) users and two different browsers (Safari v1.2, recent FireFox).
fields.summary: Enabling gzip compression breaks dashboard

fields.description:
Project Statistics are not updating.

When i updated the fix for version on a ticket, the project info does not reflect the change.

I tried flushing the cache but that didn't help and i noticed the refresh statistics option is no longer available.
fields.summary: Project Statistics are not updating

fields.description:
View an issue - select the printer symbol in the upper right corner - printable decorator is displayed.

The link 'Back to previous view' in the upper left corner never returns to the previous view (instead displays the printable decorator again).
fields.summary: Printable decoration - Link back to previous view does not work

fields.description:
If you restrict "Viewable by" for a comment to some group when updating an issue, the notification email contains the comment for all users.

When adding a direct comment to an issue, then the "Viewable by" setting works as you would expect. If the reporter or assignee is not in the group set to "viewable by" then she will not get the comment email. 

Please fix all other comments to work like this. Then it would be consistent and users could add restricted comments where ever needed, ie. not show all comments to customers. 

I would prefer if the viewable by would restrict the whole notification sending. So if I selected viewable by to jira-developers while editing an issue, then the updated email would be sent only to jira-developers.
fields.summary: If comment is not viewable by user, do not send a notification with the comment to the user

fields.description:
In previous versions of JIRA it was possible to assign an issue to the person the issue was already assigned to. This meant you could make an issue go from resolved/rejected to assigned status. This has changed and now it is necessary to reopen the issue. This means that we have to give resolve/reopen permissions to QA, which is only half correct. Only developers should be able to resolve issues, but both QA and development should be able to reopen them. This worked fine before when we could go from resolved to assigned without passing reopened. 

It is a bit weird that you can "reopen" an issue that has never been closed!
fields.summary: Unable to assign to assignee

fields.description:
When a JIRA instance is using a nonstandard, fairly intricate workflow (as will become common in 2.7), it is easy to forget where one is in the workflow (what just happened, what needs to happen for resolution). One gets lost in a mazy of twisty little passages, all alike.

It would be useful if, associated with each workflow step, one could associate a help message. Say that only a QA member can take an issue from "Fixed" to "Verified".  Instead of simply displaying no workflow options, one could display a message: "You have marked the bug as fixed.  As QA member has been notified and will take this issue further".

This should be pretty simple to do, as OSWorkflow allows metadata to be associated with each step.  We can just fish out the 'note' metadata for the current step and display it.  Similarly, we could associate a description with <action> elements, and show this info on a mouse roller.
fields.summary: Workflow improvement: say what just happened, what happens next

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3354].
  {panel}

note: = (equal) sign is used to improve readability ;)

we often use =l'=, =d'=, followed by a word (samples: l'homme, 'autre, etc).
in french, these are two words, and searching for =homme= should return
issues where =l'homme= appears.
unfortunately, Jira (lucene?) does not work correctly and returns issues with =l'homme= only if =l'homme= is used...

how can I work around this?

note: if setting up lucene with french behaviour is possible, it would not be that good, since some projects are in english, and some other in
french...
fields.summary: Allow to set indexing language per project
Add properties to version (due-date, theme/description)

fields.description:
A graphical overview of created, resolved and closed issues over a certain period of time.

Just a linegraph with three different colored lines for created, resolved and closed issues over a user selectable period of time (e.g. last week, last month, start/end date), measured on a dayly interval.
fields.summary: A graphical overview of created, resolved and closed issues over a certain period of time

fields.description:
Add awt headless setting to standlone command line args so as to enable thumbnail functionality on UNIX systems without displays:

-Djava.awt.headless=true
fields.summary: Add AWT headless setting for thumbnails on UNIX systems without displays.

fields.description:
When showing a list of files for a revision need to group the files into:
- Changed Files
- Added Files
- Deleted Files

This can be done using the methods isInitialRevision() and isDead() of the net.sf.statcvs.model.CvsRevision class.
fields.summary: More Information on files for the Version Control Tab

fields.description:
When the VCS update service rereads the cvs log output the cvs update is not issued. This causes  warnings to be printed to the standard error by the netbeans cvs library.

Please note that the VCS tab still has the correct information.

Need to issue "cvs update" before doing "cvs log" to avoid the warning messages.
fields.summary: CVS update is not issued
Calendar picker broken with Safari

fields.description: This might just be me not understanding a design decision, but In our shop, we generally won't assign issues, each developer will pick up an issue and run with it. Of course, we want everyone to indicate that if they pickup an issue that they've "started progress" on it so no one else will mess with it, but it seems that you have to assign yourself to the issue first, which seems like a wasted step...
fields.summary: Assign and start progress in one step

fields.description:
There's no links on your site for submitting bugs, etc by just sending an email.

There really should be. You'll get a lot more feedback by making it easier to submit issues.
fields.summary: How to submit bugs and suggestions for JIRA through email

fields.description: Several of the combo and list boxes only show 3-4 lines at a time, This is just too small. For instance the versions lists. From the field config window, there should be a way to configure this.
fields.summary: Combo boxes and list boxes need to be able to specify their size (ie number of lines visible)

fields.description: When you bulk edit issues there is no option to set the due date.
fields.summary: Can't bulk edit due dates.

fields.description:
We have multiple CVS repositories in our organisation which are fed from the same ViewCVS installation.

ViewCVS supports multiple cvsroots by appending &cvsroot=RootName to the  -end- of the URL.

Currently JIRA cannot handle this scenario, so an additional field is required for the CVS repository to use ( a simple text edit field ).
fields.summary: CVS Integration needs to support multiple ViewCVS roots

fields.description:
When user is not logged in, remoteUser is null so these JIRA queries fall over with an UndeclaredException.

For the moment we are telling users to remove this from the query string before pasting in Confluence RSS macro.
fields.summary: Exception thrown for anonymous access of RSS feeds of queries that query on assignee/current user/reporter/etc

fields.description:
It would be great if the CVS integration could be extended to support tracking issues within repositories that can only be accessed via the ext protocol over ssh.

Ideally, some mechanism for specifying the ssh keys would be present as well.
fields.summary: Extend the CVS integration to support ext protocol over ssh

fields.description: If you search for a relative due date, this is not propagated to the RSS view.
fields.summary: Searching for due dates does not show in rss feed

fields.description: Currently the screenshot applet does not include the context path of the application.  So the URL is always pointing to '/secure/applet/screenshot.jar', but if you have deployed JIRA to '/jira' then the URL should be '/jira/secure/applet/screenshot.jar'.
fields.summary: Screenshot applet path does not include context path

fields.description:
When uploading an image attachment into JIRA 2.6, the thumbnail view on the issue page is broken.

A broken image icon appears, and the URL attached to the image is simply "localhost:9090/secure/attachment//" (there is no filename, directory, etc.). However, if I go to the Manage Attachments view, the attachments are properly listed and I can view them there.
fields.summary: Image thumbnails are broken in 2.6

fields.description:
I created a filter a to show me all issues in which had Component = "No Component". For some reason, there are issues that  show up via the filter that have an actual component. These issuese were originally created with NO COMPONENENT, but were later Edited and now show up in the Change History as having an actual component. When selecting the issue  , the issues clearly have a component.
But the filter does not reflect this.
fields.summary: Filtering on a component does not pick up component change in Change History

fields.description:
Can Jira intergrate with

Integration with Test Director
Integration with Sales Force
Intergration with CVS Ant

also does Jira offer Support or option to have system hosted
fields.summary: configuration with other applications

fields.description: auto assignment- can Jira do a customized auto assignment?
fields.summary: auto assignment

fields.description:
Is there a size limit on the attachement or type of attachments allowed.

thanks
fields.summary: size limite on attachements

fields.description: If you pull up an Excel report on a site with a custom image that is bigger than JIRA's outof the box, the size of the image isn't taken into consideration in the output of the table cells, so Excel just prints the image as is. It ends up covering up text on the report. Steps to reproduce 1) Customize the logo and set it's width and height attributes (bigger than 111x33). 2) Pull up any filter search. 3) Click Excel report. You'll see the bigger image ends up on top of the report title. If you save-as and look at the HTML, it's just the enclosing TD that needs to ALSO specify the height:
fields.summary: Excel doesn't take custom logo size into consideration

fields.description: When clicking on the "Assigned To Me" link in the open issues portlet on the dashboard all the users issues are displayed in the issue navigator. These are listed with the trivial issues first and the blockers all the way in the end. This should of cause be the other way around.
fields.summary: When clicking "Assigned To Me" link on dashboard isses are displayed in reverse order
Project Categories should also display on dashboards when "Project" portlet is used

fields.description:
When searching for:

+add +new +permission

in the JIRA project, I get a bunch of results. But when searching for:

+add* +new +permission*

in the JIRA project, I get zero results. The latter search should at least return as many results as the first search - if not more.
fields.summary: Wildcards in seach does not work as expected

fields.description: When adding a new permission to a permission scheme you see the "Add New Permission" page. If I choose a group from the group listbox, the group radio button is not selected by default. It would be nice if the radio button was selected either if I selected a group or typed in a user in the "Single User" text field.
fields.summary: Autoselect group radio button when selecting a group (Add New Permission)

fields.description:
Currently there is a very plain style of entering description, environments and comments. Its all plain / raw text based and there is no way to enhance the output to make it more readable.

Confluence style page codes (for bolding, linking, macro's etc) being ported to JIRA would be excellent ... especially being able to include a screenshot / image in a specific block of text. Tables would be the biggest benifit.
fields.summary: Confluence style data entry

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3325].
  {panel}

When JIRA is shut down, all work in progress such as issues being edited, is lost.

Please add a new "JIRA is going down" feature:

1) New tool in administration which would allow the system to be marked as "down".
2) Change the UI to 
 - prevent new session creation when system is "down", with a notice that jira is going down
 - inform all users who are currently logged on in all pages that jira is going down shortly, "please log out now"
3) New tool in Admin which tells which users have an active session on the system at the time of shutting down

This would improve Jira's maintainability a lot. Also the same feature should be ported to Confluence, should I report an issue on CONF as well?
fields.summary: "Service is going down" handling
